about.title: Staking.Simplified.
about.text: Stkr is a decentralized protocol and platform that combines staking and DeFi, implementing elements from traditional staking with non-custodial management, Micropools, instant liquidity and decentralized governance.

calculate.title:
Calculate
your earnings
calculate.subtitle: This calculator is based on a estimation of 15 percent of annual staking rewards.

features.title: Why Stkr?
features.text: Stkr is built by the Ankr team, to provide the best user experience and highest level of safety, combined with an attractive reward mechanism and instant staking liquidity through a bond-like synthetic token called aETH.
features.micropool-text: Stake from as little as 0.5 ETH and as much as 1,000 ETH, to automatically join other stakers in Micropools!
features.manager-text: Send all of your ETH in one transaction and Stkr will automatically allocate your funds to the best pools.
features.liquidity-text: With aETH, you can hold or trade your staked assets at any time, without having to wait until transactions are enabled on Ethereum 2.0.
features.security-text: Keep your funds under your own custody, to always remain in full control of your assets.

roles.title: The 3 rolesin the Stkr system
roles.eth-staker-text: Stakers can stake any amount of ETH tokens (minimum 0.5 ETH) to earn staking rewards and platform fees. The staked ETH will immediately be liquid in the form of aETH, which users can use to trade or participate in DeFi. Stakers can stake ANKR in addition to their ETH stake to increase rewards from platform fees.
roles.node-provider-text: Node providers will be running Ethereum 2.0 nodes either on their own hardware or using the Ankr platform, to earn from the staking rewards and platform fees.
roles.governance-text: Governors will ensure the long term sustainability of the platform. A substantial stake of ANKR tokens is necessary to become part of the Stkr governance board (a governor does not necessary need to be a node provider).

become-provider.title:
Become
a provider
become-provider.text: Become a provider by running Ethereum 2.0 nodes on Ankr with no hardware or technical knowledge required.
become-provider.api-text: Easily build Web3 products with instant API access to Ethereum's various testnets and mainnets.
become-provider.knowledge-text: By running Ethereum 2.0 nodes on Ankr, no hardware or technical knowledge is required.
become-provider.governance-text: Become a Governor in order to influence decisions made about the Stkr platform!

faq.title: FAQ
faq.answer-1: Stkr is a decentralized protocol and platform that combines staking and DeFi to remove entry barriers and democratize staking for everyone.
faq.question-2: Can I stake if I have less than 32 ETH?
faq.answer-2: Yes! To democratize access to Ethereum 2.0 for users who are unable to invest 32 ETH (the fixed amount required by the network), Stkr introduces Micropools – a proprietary solution that enables you to start staking with as little as 0.5 ETH. Simply choose the amount you want to delegate, and the system will automatically assign it to the best providers.
faq.answer-3: The Micropools mechanism is our unique solution for breaking down the economic barriers for Ethereum 2.0 staking. As the name implies, Micropools allow users to chip in smaller portions of ETH towards a Validator, and receive a proportionate reward based on their contribution.
faq.question-4: Will my funds become illiquid if I stake them before transactions are enabled on Ethereum 2.0?
faq.answer-4: No – Stkr effectively tackles the illiquidity issue of Ethereum 2.0 by introducing aETH and other synthetic assets that will enable you to sell your stake at any point in time.
faq.question-5: I have more than 32 ETH. Can I still stake with Stkr?
faq.answer-5: Despite that Ethereum 2.0 only enables you to stake multiples of 32 ETH, with Stkr you can stake all your tokens at once, without having to allocate them to multiple nodes. This means you can even stake 1,000 ETH in just one click!
faq.question-6: Can I run my own Ethereum 2.0 node on Stkr?
faq.answer-6: Yes! You can become a provider and run your own node to collect staking rewards. If you don’t have any hardware or technical knowledge to set up a node, you can always use Ankr and deploy your Ethereum 2.0 node in one click.
faq.question-7: What do I need to become a provider on Stkr?
faq.answer-7: To become a provider in Stkr and earn platform fees, you need to set up an Ethereum 2.0 node with a minimum “insurance” stake of 2 ETH to compensate users in case of slashing events.

features.1: Stake any amount of ETH (minimum 0.5 ETH) to earn staking rewards.
features.2: Keep your staked ETH liquid to trade, sell or participate in DeFi applications through aETH.

features.1: Run Ethereum 2.0 nodes and earn from staking rewards and platform fees.
features.2: Stake additional Ankr in your node to obtain a higher trust-level and have your micropools prioritized as well as earning more rewards!
features.3: Use the Ankr platform to host your nodes, to remove all technical and operational barriers, and avoid any slashing charges!

not-enough-balance.title: To create the first beacon node, you need to top-up your balance

top-up.title: Top-up your balance
top-up.ankr-min-deposit-notice: You need {value} ANKR on your wallet
top-up.eth-top-up-note:
Please note that if your insurance ever drops below 2 ETH due to slashing penalties, your node may stop running. To prevent this from happening, or to restart a node that has stopped because of this, please ensure your remaining insurance balance is at least 2 ETH. You can top this amount up here.

Also note that once deposited, any insurance amount remains locked in the Stkr system until the contract ends (Ethereum 2.0 Phase 1.5 release).

rules-dialog.title: Rules of a Proposal
rules-dialog.subtitle: For any proposal, the following rules have been defined

item.1: Once the proposal is created, it will be available for voting.
item.2: The creator’s 5.000.000 ANKR will be locked for 2 weeks.
item.3: The creator will not be able to create another proposal with same locked tokens. However, he/she can still vote for other proposals.
item.4: An address can create at most 2 proposals in a month.
item.5: Once the voting period is ended, if the proposal has been accepted with a majority vote, then the proposal will be implemented by the Stkr team in the following 15 up to 30 days.

description.timing: Please set a time frame for the project. Select the number of days below

project-created-dialog.title: Project created!
project-created-dialog.subtitle: Your project got moderation, it will be launched after verification

item.1: To  participate  in  a  proposal,  users  must  give  allowance  to  Stkr’s  AnkrDepositContract.
item.2: Every deposited ANKR token has only one voting power (i.e., more tokens morevote power).
item.3: Users can deposit tokens before the voting period or while they vote.
item.4: Users can participate multiple proposals by voting with the same deposited tokens(as long as the address has sufficient ANKR tokens).
item.5: The voting power is equal to their deposit amount.
